intro: Erophila verna var. sessiliflora, commonly known as the early violet, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its violet-blue flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the stems are upright and branching. The flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects.
